title: UNRWA head Philippe Lazzarini: 'There is a risk we'll get used to what I see as a deliberate and manufactured famine'
subhead: The commissioner general of the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees tells Le Monde that countries have an 'extremely broad range' of options to 'stop all the atrocities being committed' in the enclave.

title: Marine Le Pen's appeal trial to be held in January-February 2026
subhead: The leader of the French far right is appealing a conviction of embezzlement, for which she was banned from running in elections and handed a four-year prison sentence, two of which were suspended.

title: Frédéric Péchier, an anesthesiologist accused of 30 poisonings, goes on trial
subhead: The 53-year-old doctor's criminal trial is set to begin on Monday. According to the investigating judges, whose accusations he has denied, he was 'the common denominator' in a long series of 'serious adverse events.'

title: Tradition done right: Five Paris restaurants reimagining the classics
subhead: Are you a fan of French cuisine classics such as 'œufs en meurette' (poached eggs in red wine sauce), 'navarin d'agneau' (lamb stew) and apple tart? Discover our selection of five Paris restaurants that awaken both the appetite and a sense of nostalgia.

Putin's eternally inscrutable diplomacy
subhead: Between fake diplomatic overtures in Alaska and real military offensives in Ukraine, the Kremlin has maintained its ambiguity and heightened Europeans' concerns.

title: Fashion retreats from diversity: 'We are again being openly asked for Caucasian models'
subhead: Until recently, the industry enthusiastically embraced the major social issues stirring society. From supporting Pride to Black Lives Matter, to championing inclusivity in the representation of bodies and identities, fashion seemed in tune with the times. But the tide has turned. The election of Donald Trump, who issued a series of anti-diversity executive orders, has changed everything.
byline: By Sophie Abriat and Valentin Pérez

title: 'Block Everything': While September 10 movement echoes the Yellow Vests, it also has key differences
subhead: While the call to 'block everything' on Wednesday, September 10, brings to mind the Yellow Vest protests of 2018, the choice of a weekday, the involvement of unions, and the support of left-wing parties give this social movement its own distinct character.
